materials.raw_text: Ce: 10 g, Co: 20 g, Ru: 30 g, Sn: 60 g

sourcing.instructions: Ce (Cerium) - Available from chemical supply companies or online vendors. Co (Cobalt) - Obtain from metal suppliers or specialty metal stores. Ru (Ruthenium) - Purchase from precious metal suppliers. Sn (Tin) - Commonly found in hardware stores or online chemical suppliers.
steps: Ce (Cerium) - Available from chemical supply companies or online vendors. Co (Cobalt) - Obtain from metal suppliers or specialty metal stores. Ru (Ruthenium) - Purchase from precious metal suppliers. Sn (Tin) - Commonly found in hardware stores or online chemical suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a fume hood, combine Ce, Co, Ru, and Sn in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the mixture until homogenous. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible that can withstand high temperatures.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a fume hood, combine Ce, Co, Ru, and Sn in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the mixture until homogenous. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible that can withstand high temperatures.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature gradually (approximately 8 hours). 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature gradually (approximately 8 hours). 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand down any rough edges with fine-grit sandpaper. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface finish and protection.
